Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur reveals its exhibition line up for the 15th edition. 
First in line is the robotic band from Japan which will fuse together,  music and Technology. 

Next up is Team Synergy,  a lunar robot from Croatia and one of the top teams of the Google Lunar XPrize. 

The third exhibition is Indro 3.0,  the tallest humanoid robot of India. 

And last but not the least is a 3D mapping drone from India.

For all the Bollywood cinephiles present out there, the time has come!
Few filmmakers carry a signature style that separates their work from others, and Imtiaz Ali is one of them. His direction of Jab We Met earned him critical and commercial success while Love Aaj Kal and Rockstar made him a noted filmmaker.There is an effortless realism in his films, a sense of ease in which his characters converse - they often tend to verbalise their emotions.

Be there at TOAT on 21st January to learn the other sides of his story, the unspoken lines, and the unwritten verse. 
#KTJ2k18

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur is honored to present before you, Mr. D Sivanandan as the third keynote speaker, in continuation of the streak of eminent personalities. He held the position of the Police Commissioner of Mumbai, promoted as part of the aftermath of the November 2008 Mumbai attacks. He is one of India's most well-known and highly regarded IPS officers. He was also Deputy Director of Intelligence Bureau and Joint Director of CBI. 

Get ready to fly high with the experiences of multiple high-profile postings over 35 years in Indian Police Service.

Small unmanned aerial vehicles have numerous applications in civilian sectors in which stable, controllable flight of the vehicle through precise manipulation of the aerodynamic surfaces is required. A flight computer, the “autopilot,” translates higher-level commands into appropriate instructions to the surfaces and hence, it makes up for a pilot.  
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Asteria Aerospace Pvt. Ltd. presents a tech-talk on the topic 'Autopilot for Unmanned Aerial Systems'.

Register at www.ktj.in/workshop

Small unmanned aerial vehicles have numerous applications in civilian sectors, In all these applications, stable, controllable flight of the vehicle is essential.The controllable flight of aircraft requires the precise manipulation of aerodynamic surfaces. Pilots do not affect these actuators directly. Instead, a flight computer, the “autopilot,” translates higher-level commands into appropriate commands to the surfaces. 
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Asteria Aerospace Pvt. Ltd. Pvt. Ltd. presents a tech-talk on the topic 'Autopilot for Unmanned Aerial Systems'.

Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Technology Robotix Society presents you 'Poles Apart'. The engineers are trying to design a vehicle that is capable of adapting itself to the rough terrain it is sent into. You are asked to design the prototype of such a bot that is capable of changing the distance between its wheels so as to cover a ground that cannot be done otherwise. There are multiple valleys that converge, diverge or are in an arc form and are to be crossed. 
Your challenge is to design a bot robust enough to adapt itself according to the valleys it faces. There are also certain parts of the path that you need to complete before you can cover the further ground. Use a mechanical gripper to complete this problem statement.

Prizes Worth INR 45,000
For more information go to: www.robotix.in/event/poles-apart/
Register at www.ktj.in/event

Robotic Soccer is an example of complex tasks in which multiple agents need to collaborate in an adversarial environment to achieve specific objectives. It offers a challenging research domain to investigate a large spectrum of issues relevant to the development of complete autonomous agents.
Kshitij, IIT Kharagpur in association with Kharagpur RoboSoccer Students' Group (KRSSG) presents Code-O-Soccer, a simulation-based strategy coding competition, where soccer strategies brewing within one's mind are implemented on a robot.

Prizes worth INR 50,000
Register at www.ktj.in/event
For more details visit http://event.krssg.in/
Facebook forum to get the insight on the event:- http://tinyurl.com/code-o-soccer
Submit your codes before 5th January 2018
